page.lettertext:
fol.214r
But forasmuche as none can better deale inwardly & privatly
with
Monsieur Barnevilt
then yo
r
selfe, Her
Ma
tie
would have
yo
u
intymate unto him, That howsoever her Ma
tie
may be con-
tent externallie to digest this manner of dealinge for the tyme,
because the common Ennemy shall not make his particuler
advantage of any drynesse betwe
e
n the Queene and them; yet
can it not but worke somme Impression of unkindnesse in her
Ma
tis
princely brest, w
ch
will breake out at one tyme or other:
and therefore to advise him, as a good Patryott to them, and a
wellwiller to the common cause, to worke them to some better fashi
o
:
whom yo
u
may assure That if they shall come over presently
w
th
power to offer as good a Project at the least, or a better if
yt may be, then that w
ch
he delivered you at
yo
r
last returne,
That in suche case both shee will particulerly have sence of
his good affection, and can be contented that they shall send
their Deputies, whom shee will favourably receave as messengers
from her frindes and neighbours, at w
ch
tyme you may ether
returne in their company or some fewe dayes before them, as
you see cause. Her Ma
tie
hath in this forme given like aun-
swere to their Agent, who I doubt not will clear
e
ly & par-
ticulerly relate the same.
